projects.title: Virtual Dinner Guest Project: Beirut - The Hague
projects.description: The Virtual Dinner Guest Project brings together different communities over virtual dinners. For the 2014 Euro-Arab Dialogue Conference, a group of students in The Hague and another in Beirut enjoyed a virtual dinner together in which they exchanged views about the opportunities and challenges that characterise multicultural, pluralistic societies. After the first dinner, each group asked the other group a question that was then presented to members of the groups' respective societes. During the second dinner, the responses were discussed. This projected resulted in a video that was shown during the 2014 Euro-Arab Dialogue Conference organised by the Lutfia Rabbani Foundation in the Peace Palace in The Hague. The report published about this conference can be found here: http://www.rabbanifoundation.org/report/.

courses.name: Bible and Babel: Studies in The Bible and Ancient Near East

profile_positions.description:
▪ Conducting doctoral research on transnational labor solidarity, supervised by Professor D. Bohle;
▪ As a Research Assistant to a SOLID-ERC project co-coordinated by Professor Hanspeter Kriesi, I coded Dutch media coverage of policy responses to COVID-19 in the first phase of the pandemic (January-July 2020).
profile_positions.title: PhD Researcher

profile_positions.description:
▪ Convened and coordinated a global coalition of 50+ international organizations (among which 
Oxfam, the International Trade Union Confederation, all Global Union Federations, and 
Oxfam) and guided the formulation of a joint set of Common Demands in the struggle against 
Amazon’s expanding global power;
▪ Convened and coordinated a legislative alliance of 400+ parliamentarians from 34 countries 
and 6 continents, who signed an Open Letter to Jeff Bezos, denouncing Amazon’s debts to 
workers, society, and the planet;
▪ Coordinated two global days of action – Black Friday (November 27) and Amazon’s 2021 
AGM (May 26) – during which thousands of workers and activists protested in 15 countries.
profile_positions.title: Campaign Coordinator #MakeAmazonPay

volunteer_experiences.description: The GNAP Foundation aims to support charity projects in low income countries, particularly projects that are focused on development through education. As member of the foundation's board, I am occupied with two projects: one improving living conditions in Ethiopian prisons and another building a potatoe-greenhouse for a community of farmers in Burundi.
Gilde/Samenspraak brengt nieuwkomers in Nederland in contact met vrijwilligers om gedurende een jaar iedere week samen te komen om Nederlands te spreken.

For the Umubano Foundation, I taught Dutch in the disadvantaged district of Schilderswijk in The Hague. The students were mostly immigrants who wanted to master the Dutch language in order to be able to find a job and integrate in society.
